now an important factor to keep in mind with all of this is that cost affects the minimal addictive dose because if you can freely easily without any consequence just taken lots and lots of nicotine then that unit dose that's available has to be very very low but the more costly each dose the higher the threshold can be

so the higher the cost in terms of effort finances fear of consequences restrictions and so forth the higher the reinforcing threshold may be in the case of young people there are a lot of contingencies and cost sensitivities that are more pronounced with them than with adults
